meanings.sent1: He whomped the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: She whomped the drum loudly at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The chef whomped the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The storm whomped against the windows all night long.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler whomped his opponent to the ground with a powerful move.

meanings.sent1: The whomp of the hammer echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The boxer delivered a whomp to his opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent3: The clown's whomp on the head with a rubber chicken made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The final whomp of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The whomp of the falling tree could be heard from far away.

meanings.sent1: The team whomped their rivals in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: She whomped her opponent in the chess match with a brilliant move.
meanings.sent3: The cat whomped the mouse in the game of cat and mouse.
meanings.sent4: The superhero whomped the villain and saved the city.
meanings.sent5: The student whomped the test, getting a perfect score.
